conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_E. At this stage we’re keeping the place open while we review the overall pool of families engaging with us across rounds, and we make an offer only when we’re ready to finalize.

If you’d like us to better assess fit and readiness, the most helpful details would be:
1) Your preferred start date (and earliest possible start date)
2) Needed schedule (days/hours) and whether you can accommodate our standard hours if needed
3) Any constraints we should know (transition needs, allergies/medical considerations, etc.)
4) Confirmation you can complete paperwork and deposit promptly if an offer is made

While we can’t share internal ranking mechanics in detail, readiness to start on our timeline and flexibility with scheduling are particularly important when we decide whom to finalize with.

If you reply with the above, we’ll take it into account for upcoming decisions.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_E has quota 1 and remains unmatched. My true priority ranks Parent_E 4th (A, C, B, E, D). With only Parent_E in the inbox this round and no binding application, the best move is to [TALK], request concrete info (start date, schedule, paperwork readiness) and signal that offers are based on overall pool/priority, without promising acceptance. This preserves flexibility while maintaining Parent_E as a fallback option if higher-priority candidates do not apply.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions,

Thank you for your guidance. I’m Parent_E and I would like to formally apply for the available place.

Here are the details you requested:
1) Start date: We can start immediately. Earliest possible start date is as soon as you can schedule (including next week). Our preferred start date is the earliest date you have available.
2) Schedule: We can accommodate your standard hours and are flexible on days/hours if needed. Please let me know your required schedule and we will align to it.
3) Constraints: No medical/allergy or transition constraints to flag at this time.
4) Paperwork/deposit: We can complete all paperwork and pay any required deposit immediately upon offer (same day).

We are ready to finalize quickly on your timeline and would be grateful for the opportunity to join Nursery_E.

Kind regards,
Parent_E

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for checking in and for reiterating your readiness to finalize quickly.

1) Timeline: We plan to make a final decision within the next 1–2 rounds. We are keeping the place open briefly to see the full set of families who engage with us in the immediate rounds before we issue an offer.

2) Additional information: At this point, the only additional items that could help are (a) confirmation of the specific days/hours you would enroll for (even if fully flexible, please state your intended default schedule), and (b) whether you are able to attend a short visit/intro meeting on short notice.

If you send those two details, we will keep your application active for final consideration as we move toward a decision.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for confirming, and we appreciate you proactively preparing so we can move quickly after the visit.

Ahead of tomorrow’s 10:00–10:20 intro, the most helpful items to have ready are:
1) Child info: your child’s DOB, home address, and any emergency contact details (you can bring this as a simple note).
2) Enrollment details: confirmation you intend full-time Mon–Fri during our standard hours, and your earliest start date (you’ve indicated “immediate,” which is fine—please just restate the earliest day you could start).
3) Deposit/payment readiness: please confirm you can pay by bank transfer (preferred) or card, and that you can complete payment the same day if offered.

No forms need to be completed in advance for the intro visit; we will provide the enrollment packet immediately after the visit if we proceed.

We’ll see you tomorrow—please ring the Admissions buzzer at reception as planned.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you—everything remains set for tomorrow’s 10:00–10:20 intro visit.

To enable a smooth same-day finalization if we proceed after our end-of-day review, the only additional items that would be helpful (beyond your photo ID) are:
1) A short child info note including: child’s full legal name, DOB, home address, and two emergency contacts (name/relationship/phone).
2) If applicable, your child’s GP/clinic name and number (optional—only if you have it readily available).

No other documents are needed for the visit.

On the payment reference: if we proceed, our email will specify the exact format; in most cases it will be:
**ChildSurname_ChildFirstName_DOB** (DDMMYYYY)

As discussed, we’ll complete our review after the visit and aim to call you in the 16:30–18:00 window (phone first, then email). If we proceed, we will email the enrollment packet and bank details immediately after the call so you can transfer the deposit the same day.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

[TALK]

Parent_E has been persistent and ready to finalize, but has repeatedly been rejected to keep the seat open in case higher-priority parents (A/C/B) approach. In round 24, only Parent_E contacted us. Given remaining rounds and that Parent_E ranks Nursery_E last in their preferences, they may still accept but could leave if offered a higher choice; however in this protocol a match is binding once accepted. Still, accepting now risks missing a higher-priority parent later. Since we can continue TALK without committing and we already scheduled a visit and promised decision after visit, best is to keep engagement and not accept yet. Parent_E asked what else to bring; respond with minimal additional items and confirm process.
